definitions: Any of the pre-Olympian gods in Greek mythology, children of Uranus (Heaven) and Gaia (Earth), who were overthrown by Zeus and the Olympian gods.
A person or thing of colossal size, strength, or influence.
The largest moon of Saturn, and the second-largest moon in the Solar System.
examples: Prometheus was a Titan who stole fire for humanity.
She was a titan in the business world.
Titan is the only moon known to have a dense atmosphere.
